title: Alternate wetting and drying (AWD)--using less water to grow rice

tasks.task: Implement Alternate Wetting and Drying (AWD) irrigation technique for rice fields.
subtasks: Observe water depth in the field using a field water tube.
Reflood the field when water level drops to 15 cm below soil surface.
Monitor soil moisture levels using a constructed water tube.
Start Safe AWD a few days after transplanting or when the crop is 10 cm tall.
Postpone AWD application if necessary to control early-stage weeds.
Apply nitrogen fertilizer on dry soil before irrigation.
Maintain 5 cm water depth during grain filling to avoid stress.
Experiment with deeper drying periods once yield is stable.
Construct a field water tube using local materials.
Drill holes in the bottom 20 cm of the tube for water entry.
Position the tube vertically and check alignment with external water level.
Promote AWD adoption among local farmers.
Engage community members in AWD training and support.
Facilitate shared resources or services for AWD implementation.
Address community-level challenges to AWD adoption.

tasks.task: Monitor and adjust AWD practices based on field conditions.
subtasks: Regularly check water tube readings for accurate monitoring.
Adjust flooding schedules based on soil moisture and crop needs.
Document AWD performance and yields for continuous improvement.

tasks.task: Construct a field water tube for monitoring soil moisture.
subtasks: Cut materials to 40 cm length with 15 cm diameter.
Drill holes on all sides in the bottom 20 cm.
Space holes every 2 cm, diameter about 0.5 cm.
Ensure the tube is stable in the soil, buried halfway with 20 cm above ground.
Check the tube's water level against the external soil surface.

tasks.task: Adjust sprinkler irrigation timing based on water scarcity.
subtasks: Determine when fields can go dry due to reduced water availability.
Transition to AWD as a response to water stress.
Follow AWD procedures even under water scarcity.

subtasks: Conduct workshops on AWD principles and application.
Demonstrate proper use of field water tubes.
Address farmer concerns and provide support resources.
